docs.abstract: Apple said it was removing the HKmap.live app, which was criticized by Chinese state media, because the Hong Kong authorities said protesters used it to attack the police.
docs.snippet: Apple said it was removing the HKmap.live app, which was criticized by Chinese state media, because the Hong Kong authorities said protesters used it to attack the police.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Apple removed an app late Wednesday that enabled protesters in Hong Kong to track the police, a day after facing intense criticism from Chinese state media for it, plunging the technology giant deeper into the complicated politics of a country that is fundamental to its business.

headline.main: Apple Removes App That Helps Hong Kong Protesters Track the Police
headline.print_headline: After China Objects, Apple Removes App Hong Kong Protesters Use to Track Police

docs.abstract: Margrethe Vestager, whose billion-dollar fines have made her loathed by Silicon Valley, has won new powers that give her unrivaled regulatory reach. President Trump says she “hates the United States.”
docs.snippet: Margrethe Vestager, whose billion-dollar fines have made her loathed by Silicon Valley, has won new powers that give her unrivaled regulatory reach. President Trump says she “hates the United States.”
docs.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — For five years, Margrethe Vestager was the scourge of Silicon Valley, levying billions of dollars in fines and initiating investigations against Google, Apple and Facebook for violating antitrust laws and harming consumers.

headline.main: E.U.’s New Digital Czar: ‘Most Powerful Regulator of Big Tech on the Planet’
headline.print_headline: E.U.’s New Digital Czar Expands Her Portfolio

docs.abstract: The decision to make the automaker repay taxes saved in a deal with Luxembourg offers clues about a similar case against Apple.
docs.snippet: The decision to make the automaker repay taxes saved in a deal with Luxembourg offers clues about a similar case against Apple.
docs.lead_paragraph: LUXEMBOURG — The second-highest court in the European Union ruled on Tuesday that the automaker Fiat Chrysler must pay back about $33 million in taxes that it saved by carving out a deal with Luxembourg, a decision that could have implications in cases involving other global corporations, including a multibillion-dollar suit against Apple.

headline.main: E.U. Court Orders Fiat Chrysler to Pay Back $33 Million in Taxes
headline.print_headline: E.U. Court Orders  Fiat Chrysler to Pay $33 Million in Taxes

byline.original: By Milan Schreuer and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

docs.abstract: Three films acquired by Apple will reach theaters this fall. And the company is working with the studio A24 on producing Sofia Coppola’s next movie.
docs.snippet: Three films acquired by Apple will reach theaters this fall. And the company is working with the studio A24 on producing Sofia Coppola’s next movie.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Apple is going to the movies.

headline.main: Apple Steps Into the Movie Business
headline.print_headline: With 3 Feature Releases, Apple Goes to the Movies

docs.abstract: On an ultra-low-cost carrier, there seems to be a price for anything extra. Here’s the gear we suggest you pack to have a comfortable flight.
docs.snippet: On an ultra-low-cost carrier, there seems to be a price for anything extra. Here’s the gear we suggest you pack to have a comfortable flight.
docs.lead_paragraph: When you are flying budget economy on a legacy carrier, the in-flight experience isn’t much different from regular economy (though your odds of getting the middle seat skyrocket). But on an ultra-low-cost carrier — such as Allegiant, Frontier, Ryanair or Spirit — you pay for food and drink, plus any bags beyond a personal item, and, at the moment, there’s no onboard entertainment or Wi-Fi. So, along with your collapsible water bottle, add these items to your packing list.

headline.main: 7 Must-Have Items for Your Next Ultra-Budget Flight

docs.abstract: Outlets are trying to intimidate multinational companies into toeing the party line while Beijing tries to rein in the Hong Kong protests.
docs.snippet: Outlets are trying to intimidate multinational companies into toeing the party line while Beijing tries to rein in the Hong Kong protests.

headline.main: Chinese Media’s Attacks on Apple and N.B.A. Help Inflame Nationalism
headline.print_headline: As China Pounces, Apple Withdraws Police-Tracking App

docs.abstract: The E.U.’s top antitrust regulator ordered Broadcom to halt specific practices while the bloc investigates possible anticompetitive activity.
docs.snippet: The E.U.’s top antitrust regulator ordered Broadcom to halt specific practices while the bloc investigates possible anticompetitive activity.
docs.lead_paragraph: European authorities took an even more aggressive approach than usual to regulating the technology industry Wednesday when they applied a rarely used rule, ordering a company to halt a potentially anticompetitive practice while an investigation is underway.

headline.main: Europe’s Margrethe Vestager Takes a Rare Step Toward Big Tech
headline.print_headline: E.U. Regulator Will Rein In Broadcom During Antitrust Inquiry

docs.abstract: A reporter who has covered the tech industry for more than two decades explains how we may be entering a progressive era of antitrust.
docs.snippet: A reporter who has covered the tech industry for more than two decades explains how we may be entering a progressive era of antitrust.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, we review the week’s news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: How Is Antitrust Enforcement Changing?
headline.print_headline: A New Outlook on Antitrust Is Taking Shape

docs.abstract: Apple has been advertising its watch’s ability to detect atrial fibrillation. The reality doesn’t quite live up to the promise.
docs.snippet: Apple has been advertising its watch’s ability to detect atrial fibrillation. The reality doesn’t quite live up to the promise.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Apple Watch has been quite successful as a smart watch. The company would also like it to succeed as a medical device. The recently published results of the Apple Heart Study in the New England Journal of Medicine show there’s still a long way to go.

headline.main: The Watch Is Smart, but It Can’t Replace Your Doctor
headline.print_headline: The Watch Is Smart, but It Can’t Replace Your Doctor

docs.abstract: The request could reignite a fight between the Silicon Valley giant and law enforcement over access to encrypted technology.
docs.snippet: The request could reignite a fight between the Silicon Valley giant and law enforcement over access to encrypted technology.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The encryption debate between Apple and the F.B.I. might have found its new test case.

headline.main: F.B.I. Asks Apple to Help Unlock Two iPhones
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Asks Apple To Open Phones  Gunman Owned

byline.original: By Jack Nicas and Katie Benner
